subject: Re: [junit] Re: Testing several classes with the same test case
msgSnippet: ... JUnit does but unfortunately Eclipse and other IDEs do not correctly use the JUnit framework to run JUnit tests. How are you running the tests?
messageBody:
On 08/08/07, dmugtasimov <dimasoft2001@...> wrote:
> No, it does not require. I tried to do that, but found that JUnit
> does not use TestCase instance passed to suite.add() method. It just
> direves class name from the instance and them creates a new one to
> run test. I might be wrong, but I spent pretty much time and finally
> came up with the conslusion above.

JUnit does but unfortunately Eclipse and other IDEs do not correctly
use the JUnit framework to run JUnit tests.

How are you running the tests?
